data.title: Hidden Gem – Brand New Curated Home w Pool Access
data.description: Superbly designed for living, relaxing and entertaining – this remarkable townhome has everything that you need! The calming color palette with warm wooden furniture and playful jewel-toned accent pieces gives the home a grounded and serenely relaxing atmosphere. Interior highlights include three spacious bedrooms with plush new mattresses and walk-in closets, a luxurious ensuite primary bathroom, and a cozy living area with plenty of comfortable seating. Whether you are searching for a retirement getaway, interim family home, or a full-service getaway – this brand-new townhome in the intimate Mosaic neighborhood is the perfect choice!Enjoy the best of Fort Collins, right out your door! This beautiful, new townhome is centrally located and perfect for those looking to experience the true atmosphere of Fort Collins. Head up to Lory State Park and explore the hiking/biking trails, hop over to Odell for a cold fresh beer, or head downtown for an evening of live music and culinary delights. Then head home for a relaxing evening in your home away from home! You will love this intimate community within 10 minutes of the brewery district, Old Town Fort Collins and CSU. Conveniently located between Old Town and I-25, this brand-new townhome is the perfect choice for an extended stay in Fort Collins!This home features: Bedroom 1: King Bed (second level) | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed (second level) | Bedroom 3: Twin Trundle Bed (second level) | Sleeps 6 OUTDOOR LIVING:  Main level patio with a small bistro table and mountain views! There is also a community pool that is open May – September, a short 5-minute walk from this townhome! INDOOR LIVING:  Smart TV, dining table with seating for 6, laptop-friendly workspace KITCHEN:  Fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, microwave, breakfast bar with seating for 2, cooking basics, dishware/flatware, spices, complimentary coffee, creamer, tea and sweetener BATHROOMS:  There is a main floor half bath and two bathrooms on the upper level. We include hair dryers, soap, shampoo and conditioner for every guest stay. GENERAL:  High-speed WiFi, washer/dryer, linens/towels, keyless entry, central heating and air conditioning, complimentary toiletries, iron/board and cleaning essentials.  PARKING:  Two car garage and street parking is also available HOUSE RULES: No smokingNo events, parties, or large gatherings PET POLICY:  Dogs Welcome...We love dogs! However... all pets must be pre-approved (no aggressive breeds) and a pet fee will be due at booking. Unapproved pets and excessive barking or aggression are grounds for removal of pets from the property or eviction of tenants.  COMMUNITY POOL:  The community pool is open from Memorial Day to Labor Day! If your stay falls within that period, you will have access to the community pool which is conveniently located a 5-minute walk down the road. Pass is required.  NOTE:  This property is located near the Fort Collins train line which run through downtown. The train is part of the history and economy of Fort Collins and is an integral part of what Fort Collins is today. The train may be heard occasionally during your stay.   Mountain Time Vacation Rentals  is owned and operated by locals with a passion for hospitality and our amazing mountain community.  We have over 100 homes to choose from which can accommodate groups of 2 to 200.  Our Commitment to Clean: All homes and linens are professionally cleaned, sanitized, and disinfected before each and every guest. Feel free to send us an inquiry so we can help you plan the perfect getaway!

A Hidden Paradise - Bungalow 1
data.description: Welcome to Hidden Paradise! Ready for an unforgettable vacation? Bungalow #1 is a lovely home perfect of up to 6 guests. Located just a short walk from the beautiful crystal sands and community pool, this home is directly in the heart of the vibrant South Siesta Key Village. Relax by the shared community pool located at the Calini Beach Club or venture on a stroll to the beach. With 13 public beach access points, wonderful shops and restaurants, Siesta Key promises great experiences for everyone who visits. Take advantage of the tranquil waters, soft sand, and warm sun as you explore all the island has to offer and unwind at the end of a fantastic day in this beautiful home.Bedding and Televisions:Bedroom 1 - King, TVBedroom 2 - TwinsLiving room - Sleeper Sofa, TVUnit Size - 624 Sq. Ft.Added Amenities Included in Your Stay:Complimentary Bicycles Rentals,One Complimentary Parking Space,Wifi,Beach Chairs,Beach Towels,Beach Wagon,Beach Cooler,Partner Property Pool/Hot tub Access,Access to Siesta Beach Pickleball Courts,Siesta Key Trolley - Free-Rides Around Siesta Key,A 7-day week, Beachside Management office for your convenience and guest needs!Minimum Age Requirement: 23*Minimum age requirement from February 1st through April 15th for all Beachside Managed properties is 27 years of age

data.title: A Las Palmas
data.description: Welcome to Las Palmas! This gorgeous new home on Siesta Key offers luxury around every turn. Stay with up to 16 guests in this 7-bedroom, 7.5-bathroom home, complete with a private pool and spa area, fenced in yard, large full kitchen, dining room, two living spaces with a game room, and much more! Spend time outside by the pool, featuring a kid’s slide, rain curtain, pool fountains, and hot tub, all conveniently position by the patio lounge area with a BBQ grill, Mini Fridge and plenty of space for everyone to relax. Located around the corner form Siesta Key Village, this home sits across the street from beach access numbers 8 and 9. Guests can gaze out at the ocean and enjoy beautiful sunset skies from the rooftop patio or take the short walk into the Village for the many wonder shops and restaurants Siesta Key has to offer. Capture your piece of paradise with this fabulous new home. *Events possible upon request.Bedding and Televisions:Bedroom 1 – King, TVBedroom 2 – King, TVBedroom 3 – King, TVBedroom 4 – King, TVBedroom 5 – King, TVBedroom 6 – King, TVBedroom 7 – Double Twin Bunk Beds,Living Room 1 – TVLiving Room 2 – TVUnit Size - 5,000 Sq. data.title: A Tide that Binds Us - 600
data.description: Spend your vacation relaxing in this lovely 3-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom townhome. On the ground level, you will find covered parking for up to 2 cars, and storage. The second level hosts an open concept for the living room, dining, and kitchen areas. The spacious living room features rattan ceiling panels for a casual coastal vibe. The kitchen offers plenty of storage and stainless countertops. On this floor, you will also find a powder room and a balcony for enjoying the fresh island breeze. The 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms are located on the third level. The master bedroom includes 2 bathing areas, one of which is open to the bedroom and has a jetted bathtub. Located within walking distance to Siesta Key Village, this home is adjacent to beach access #10 – perfect for taking a trip down to Siesta Beach! *This property is stairs only; all guests must have the ability to use stairs.Bedroom 1 – KingBedroom 2 – QueenBedroom 3 – Two DoublesLivingroom – Queen Sleeper SofaUnit Size - 1,292 Sq. data.description: Spend your vacation relaxing in this lovely 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom townhome. On the ground level, you will find parking for up to 2 cars. The second level hosts a spacious living room, dining, and kitchen areas. The kitchen offers plenty of storage and stainless countertops. data.title: Beach Residences On Siesta, aka The Hyatt
data.description: Siesta Key’s only luxury hotel. Sitting directly on Siesta’s Quartz Beach that offers the whitest and softest sand in the World that is always cool to the touch. Relaxing and making your memories is all that’s required but located just minutes is down town’s rich art and cultural community. In the village of Siesta, you’ll be welcomed to enjoy a cool beverage under the palm trees while listening to live music, take a stroll while you shop, or find many great local cuisines. Make sure to look for the local dolphins frolicking in our crystal-clear waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Siesta Key beach, rated #1 in the country. The memories will linger long after your footprints in the sand have been washed away by the gentle waves.Our stunning accommodations need to be experienced to be believed. The spacious floor plan is perfect for family vacations. Our suite is well appointed to 5-star standards and resort-quality amenities including multiple flat screen TVs, Bose® sound systems, jetted oversized bathtubs and multi-head rain showers, king-size Grand Beds, and a fully-stocked kitchens complete with Wolf, Miele and Sub Zero appliances. Resort fee covers the following items: complimentary valet parking, premium high speed wireless internet, local calls, newspaper, business center with print me station, notary service, Stay Fit health club, bike rentals, laptops based on request, in-room safe barbeque grills, in room coffee/tea, beach services (chairs, umbrellas, towels), and water sport rentals (kayaks, paddleboards, floats).Bedroom 1- KingBedroom 2- KingBedroom 3- Queen Murphy BedUnit Size - 1,900 Sq. Ft.Please Note: Golf-Carts are NOT allowed on property grounds.*Minimum age requirement from February 1st through April 15th for all Beachside Managed properties is 27 years of age
data.image_tag: Beach Residences On Siesta, aka The Hyatt

data.title: Beach Walk
data.description: Featuring high ceilings and a spacious living area this 3-bedroom, 2.5-bath, beautifully renovated townhouse condominium presents the best Siesta Key has to experience. This multifloored unit offers the convenience of condominium living without a high-rise building. One of four townhomes in the Beach Walk complex, this home features lush tropical landscaping, paver walks, drive, and heated community pool. You will love the covered and screened outdoor rec space. Some of the features include a TV and ping pong table. Just out the door you’ll find grilling and a pool for your enjoyment. Located only a half block from the famous white sands of Siesta Beach, the No. 1 beach in the US and close to Siesta Village’s unique boutiques and restaurants, this unit is the perfect island getaway. Only 20 minutes by car to downtown Sarasota’s urban amenities, shopping, restaurants, museums, and entertainment. Just bring your sunscreen, bathing suit, and flip-flops! *Stairs only. All guests must have the ability to use stairs.*No parking in garage*Bedroom 1- KingBedroom 2- King with a work stationBedroom 3- QueenLiving Room- Queen Sleeper SofaUnit Size - 1,691 Sq. Ft.Added Amenities Included in Your Stay:Complimentary Bicycles Rentals,One Complimentary Parking Space,Wifi,Beach Chairs,Beach Towels,Beach Wagon,Beach Cooler,Partner Property Pool/Hot tub Access,Access to Siesta Beach Pickleball Courts,Siesta Key Trolly - Free-Rides Around Siesta Key,A 7-day week, Beachside Management office for your convenience and guest needs!Minimum Age Requirement: 25*Minimum age requirement from February 1st through April 15th for all Beachside Managed properties is 27 years of age

data.title: Whispering Pines - Enjoy a hot tub retreat | Near Mt. Hood | Pet-friendly
data.description:
Nestled amidst towering pine trees, Whispering Pines Cabin invites you to unwind near the iconic Mt. Hood. This rustic-modern blend is perfect for those seeking tranquility and adventure. Imagine soaking in a luxurious hot tub, truly invigorating after exploring scenic trails. The warm glow of the wood stove creates a cozy atmosphere, ideal for restful evenings. Whether sipping coffee on the deck or enjoying local exploits, this cabin promises a memorable escape. Secure your stay and indulge in the peaceful retreat that you've been dreaming of.The SpaceEscape to Whispering Pines Cabin, near Mt. Hood, for a relaxing retreat. Enjoy the invigorating hot tub and the rustic-modern comforts this cabin offers.

✔ Bask in the charm of open-beam ceilings and wood paneling
✔ Experience the warmth envelop you by the wood stove, with a novel in hand
✔ Spacious living area with plush seating and a Smart TV
✔ Fully equipped kitchen, ready for your culinary adventures
✔ Primary and second bedrooms with comfortable queen beds
✔ Bunk room designed with kids in mind
✔ Private deck perfect for morning coffee or evening relaxation
✔ Expansive yard for outdoor games, grilling, and unwinzing amidst nature
✔ Lush, luxurious hot tub for soothing evening soaks
✔ Shop with ski and snowboard storage and basketball hoop
✔ Assorted board games for fun-filled family timeGuest Access✔ Reliable free Wi-Fi to stay connected
✔ Fully equipped kitchen for delightful meals
✔ Wood stove with complimentary firewood
✔ Outdoor deck with seating and barbecue grill
✔ Ample on-site parking, hassle-free
✔ Welcoming pet policy, with prior approval and fee
✔ Convenient self check-in via smart lockNeighborhoodRelish the captivating charm around Mt. Hood, with Whispering Pines Cabin as your perfect launchpad. Situated near the tranquil Zig Zag River, adventure awaits nearby with hiking and skiing opportunities. Explore local dining gems or indulge in serene leisure amidst the picturesque backdrop. Whispering Pines is your gateway to natural beauty and endless experiences—reservations are just a click away!Other Things To Note✔ Kindly observe quiet hours for a peaceful neighborhood retreat
✔ Essentials like shampoo, conditioner, and body soap provided
✔ Pet friendly with prior approval, including a $100 pet feeGetting AroundWhether you’re seeking a quiet retreat surrounded by nature or an adventure-filled getaway near Mt. Hood, this cabin has it all. Relax by the fire after a day of exploring, or step outside to enjoy the tranquil sounds of the forest. With its convenient location and cozy atmosphere, this Rhododendron cabin offers the perfect escape for families, couples, and small groups.

Mt. Hood Skibowl: Just 20 minutes away for skiing, snowboarding, and tubing in the winter, and thrilling adventure parks in the summer.
Zigzag River & Hiking Trails: A short walk away (few minutes) from the cabin, ideal for nature walks and exploring the stunning local scenery.
Timberline Lodge: 30 minutes away for historic tours, skiing, and breathtaking views.
ZigZag Mountain Trailhead is less than a quarter mile away with many more hiking trails near by. 
Trillium Lake for kayaking and paddleboarding is just 15 miles away. House RulesCancellation Terms: Fully refundable up to 5 days before check in, then booking becomes non refundable. 
Payment Terms: 50% is due at booking and remainder 30 days before check in. If booking checks in less than 30 days 100% is due at booking.
Please respect quite hours and this is a community. 
Not glass or food while in the hot tub. 
No pets without pet fee, no cats
Minimum Age to Book: 21
Additional Rules may apply in Guest Guide Book
Pets: Dogs only, no cats. Only permitted with applicable pet fee.

data.title: Mountain Over Main Street
data.description: Overlooking the Blue Ridge Mountains and less than 1 mile from picturesque Downtown Weaverville, Mountain Over Main Street is sure to leave you with an abundance of memories and stories of the charming hidden gems and local favorites found throughout town. About the Home• Well-equipped, galley-style kitchen with gas range, dishwasher, and drip-style coffee maker.• Interior dining for 6 and outdoor dining for 8.• Living room with 60" SmartTV for streaming.• Screened-in porch with 3 swings, couch, and coffee table; access to the spacious deck with outdoor dining, gas grill, and garden with native plants; wrap-around access to covered seating on the front porch, overlooking the mountain view.• Wood burning fire pit with natural stone seating.Where to Unwind• The main level offers a primary bedroom with a stunning picture window, a king-size bed, and an en suite bathroom (walk-in shower). • The upper level offers two bedrooms, one with a queen-size bed and one with a full-over-full bunk bed (with 1 twin-size trundle); a full bathroom (bathtub and shower combination) can be accessed from the hallway.• The bonus room, steps down from the main floor, boasts a sitting area with a sleeper sofa, a card table with games, and a woodburning stove.Where to Explore• Blue Mountain Pizza & Downtown Weaverville | 0.6 miles• Reems Creek Golf Club | 7 minutes• Downtown Asheville | 14 minutes• Blue Ridge Parkway | 15 minutes• Navitat Canopy Adventures | 18 minutes• Biltmore Estate | 19 minutesPlease note: IF USING THE EXTRA BEDDING (TWIN TRUNDLE BED OR SLEEPER SOFA), YOU MUST BRING YOUR OWN SHEETS. This home does not allow pets. The converted bonus room utilizes heating and cooling from the main floor of the home and does not have its own ductwork; an electric heater and wood-burning stove are available. There is an exterior security camera facing the driveway.

data.title: Mountain Crest
data.description: Located within the private Grants Mountain community, this pet-friendly log cabin offers a peaceful, private setting and boasts beautiful mountain views along with a fire pit & gas grill to enjoy! Thoughtfully designed with memory-making in mind, this single-level cabin with 3 en-suite bedrooms is sure to be a family favorite for years to come. A chef's kitchen with eat-in dining for 6 overlooks a spacious living room with a 55" Smart TV with streaming and gas log fireplace.The private, covered back deck boasts unobstructed, year-round mountain views, outdoor dining, a gas grill, and two porch swings. Steps away from the porch, also overlooking the view, is a wood-burning fire pit. The primary bedroom offers a king-size bed, a 36" television, and an en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower. The two additional bedrooms each offer a queen-size bed and en suite bath: one with a 36" television and luxury walk-in shower and the other with a shower/tub combo.Mountain Crest is located in the quaint town of Marion within the private Grants Mountain community, offering endless natural beauty along with the convenience of being 15 minutes from downtown Marion, I-40, and a Walmart Supercenter. When exploring downtown Marion, be sure to stop into the new 310 District, an indoor shopping space that’s home to Marion Wing Factory, Toonez Chop House, Marion Hot Wheelz indoor skating rink, Chances of Sprinkles Bakery, and several retail shops.Take a 25-minute drive the reach the neighboring town of Old Fort. Known as the “Gateway to the Blue Ridge,” Old Fort sits at the base of the Blue Ridge Mountains and is surrounded by lush forests and a diverse wildlife community. Andrew's Geyser, Catawba Falls, and Point Lookout Trail are among some of the oldest and most celebrated outdoor attractions in Old Fort. After exploring the great outdoors, pop into local favorite Hillman Beer in the middle of downtown to reward yourself with a savory burger and cold brew while taking in the gorgeous river views. Mountain Crest is a 35-minute drive from the “Simply Charming” town of Morganton where you can find even more shops, regional museums, and art galleries where you can pick up a souvenir to remind you of your time in the mountains. You’ll also find even more delicious dining and drink options in Morganton like Root and Vine, Treat, Catawba Brewing Company, and the original Fonta Flora taproom. For the wine lovers in the group, take time to visit local wineries like South Creek, Silver Fork, and Perry’s Berry’s Vineyard, all within 25 miles away.In the evening, return to Marion to enjoy some nightlife at Mica Town Brewing Company and Spillway Bridge & Co. For lake enthusiasts, this home is around 35 minutes from Lake James, where you can spend your days sunbathing, swimming, and boating. For hiking enthusiasts, this home is about an hour's drive from the "gorge"-ous Linville Gorge Wilderness area and iconic Blue Ridge Parkway, which offers plenty of overlooks and hiking opportunities to choose from.Don't forget that no trip to the mountains of Western North Carolina is complete without experiencing the "Land of Sky," Asheville, located just 45 minutes away. While there, be sure to check out the hip and artsy West Asheville district, North Carolina Arboretum, and America's Largest Home, the Biltmore Estate. Asheville is also home to an impressive number of award-winning restaurants and breweries that you can sample in between all your activities. Return home after a full day of activities to unwind around the outdoor fire pit with s'mores while you discuss all of the adventures you'll embark on tomorrow. Grants Mountain is a designated IDA (International Dark Sky Community), so you'll be able to stargaze to your heart's content on clear nights!Please note: This property is pet friendly with an additional fee. There are 2 exterior security cameras facing the driveway.

data.title: Mountain Sunrise
data.description: As the sun rises on your long-awaited mountain vacation, this home is certainly worth the wait! Inspired by Old World Tudor England and the New World American Arts and Crafts movement, this newly constructed home is tucked within the polished Tudor Croft community near the heart of Black Mountain. Filled with must-have modern amenities and boasting breathtaking year-round mountain views, guests will feel part of the royal court at this contemporary and charming mountain retreat!About the Home• Well-equipped kitchen with gas range, dishwasher, and two types of coffee makers (standard drip-style and Keurig).• Living room with gas log fireplace, 55" Smart TV for streaming, and access to the covered deck overlooking a true "Mountain Sunrise" view.• Main floor laundry room with folding table and stackable washer and dryer.• A dedicated workspace with a desk and desk chair is available in the upper-level loft.Where to Unwind• The main floor bedroom offers a queen-size bed. A full bathroom, with a walk-in shower, can be accessed from the hallway.• The upper-level bedroom offers a second queen-size bed. A full bathroom, with a bathtub and shower, can be accessed from the hallway.• The upper level also boasts a spacious primary suite, overlooking the mountain view, with a king-size bed and en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower.Where to Explore• The Station, Downtown Black Mountain | 6 minutes• Lookout Brewing Company | 7 minutes• Nearest Gas and Grocery, Ingles Market | 9 minutes• The Blue Ridge Parkway | 18 minutes• Zen Tubing | 24 minutes• Downtown Asheville | 26 minutes• The Biltmore Estate | 30 minutesPlease note: This home does not allow pets. Driveway parking is available for a maximum of 2 vehicles. Overflow parking, while not guaranteed, is available nearby.

data.title: One Acre Wood
data.description: Perfect for large groups, this updated haven in the woods is just a 10-minute walk to Lake Susan and a 10-minute drive to shops, restaurants, and breweries in downtown Black Mountain. Secluded beneath a theatre of trees enjoy a large deck and a screened porch overlooking the rushing Flat Creek below surrounded by rhododendron. Seven bedrooms, a bonus bunk room, seven bathrooms, and a well-equipped kitchen make it easy to enjoy and accommodate a multi-generational crowd. Internet, smart TVs, games, puzzles, and books for all ages are available, plus easy access to hiking trails and rock-hopping in the front yard creek. AC/heat with thermostats on all three floors and in the apartment. Soak up the fresh air and relish the soothing babble of Flat Creek in this special home surrounded by breathtaking Appalachian beauty in all four seasons!House Layout:MAIN LEVEL: Well-supplied kitchen with breakfast bay for 6, two bar stools, and attached den with a wood-burning fireplace; great room with smart TV, and a dining table for 14; bedroom with a Tempur-Pedic queen bed and accessible bath; full hall bath.MAIN LEVEL ATTACHED APARTMENT: Bedroom with a king bed, smart TV, accessible bath, mini kitchen, washer-dryer, and screened porch with wood-burning fireplace and huge views!UPPER LEVEL: Master bedroom with king bed, gorgeous views, and accessible bathroom; second bedroom with a king; hall bath.LOWER LEVEL: Kitchen Sink and microwave with a table for 5; den with 2 sets of bunks and big sofa; 2 hall bathrooms; washer-dryer; bedroom with queen and bunk bed; bedroom with 2 sets of bunks; bedroom with Tempur-Pedic double bed; ping-pong table and keyboard.OUTDOORS: Large wrap-around deck. Paved driveway to both the main and lower levels, three steps, and an accessible ramp to the main level. Parking for 4 vehicles on each level; gas grill on the patio; 2 picnic tables on deck; disc golf baskets, corn hole, and giant Jenga.Please Note: Sheets and towels are not provided but may be rented through Greybeard Rentals. Accessible bathrooms have 32-inch showers. Small dogs will be considered for an extra fee, but please keep them crated when away. The owner has a Toyota Corolla parked in the lower driveway year-round. Featured Amenities: Secluded in woods, pet-friendly, Screened Porch, and rushing creek on property.

data.title: Stepping Stone
data.description: Tranquil and exquisite, Stepping Stone is located in Black Mountain's charming Cheshire Village and offers 4 bedrooms, 3 full bathrooms, and ample space for fellowship and entertainment. Walk to the heart of Cheshire for lunch, take a five-minute trip to beautiful Black Mountain for superb food and shopping, or visit Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the Biltmore Estate, which are less than 30 minutes away.About the Home• The kitchen boasts top-of-the-line Viking appliances with a gas range, dishwasher, drip-style coffee maker, and Keurig coffee maker.• Open-concept dining area with seating for 8 overlooking the living room with a wood-burning fireplace.• Covered porch with a wood-burning fireplace and cozy seating.• Lower-level recreation space with gas log fireplace, daybed-style seating, and game table.• For added convenience, a powder room is available on the main floor. Where to Unwind• The main floor primary bedroom offers a king-size bed, TV, and en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower and soaking tub.• The upper-level offers two bedrooms, each with a queen-size bed, along with a full bathroom (bathtub and shower combination), which can be accessed from the hallway.• Open-air loft with twin-size daybed, designated workspace, and TV.• Lower-level bedroom with king-size bed and en suite bathroom with bathtub and shower combination. Where to Explore• Beradu Specialty Market | 5 minute walk• Sake Sushi | 5 minute walk• Nearest Gas, Ingles iMarket | 3 minutes• Nearest Grocery, Ingles Market | 3 minutes• Downtown Black Mountain | 4 minutes• Lookout Mountain Trail Head | 13 minutes• The Blue Ridge Parkway | 13 minutes• Downtown Asheville | 19 minutes• The Biltmore Estate | 25 minutesPlease Note: True to its name, Stepping Stone requires navigating 20 stone steps from the parking space to the main entrance. Parking is available for up to 2 vehicles, with overflow parking available nearby. This home is pet-friendly for up to 2 dogs, with an additional fee.

data.title: Bluegill Lodge on Lake James
data.description: Ideally located just steps away from the private & upscale Camp Lake James community, this four-bedroom, four-and-one-half-bath sleeps up to 8 people comfortably and offers an expansive deck and screened porch, an indoor gas fireplace, an outdoor fire pit, a gas grill, and a private boat dock for easy lake access. Inside, the home is filled with sleek high-end furnishings and numerous upscale amenities. The primary bedroom boasts a California King bed while the upstairs and downstairs guest rooms both have Queen beds. The downstairs Bunkroom has two sets of bunk beds (the lower bunk is a Full size, and the top bunk is a Twin size) and two Twin Trundle beds underneath. In addition to the amenities at the home, as a guest at Bluegill Lodge, you will also be able to enjoy the exclusive amenities within Camp Lake James for the duration of your stay—take a dip in the pool, explore the lake by kayak, grab a quick bite at the Canteen, curl up by the stone outdoor fireplace, and enjoy community-led activities to your heart’s content.Located just 45 minutes from Asheville in Nebo, this upscale lakefront home is the perfect place to get away and enjoy everything the Lake James area has to offer. Outside of the community, you can spend your days exploring nearby hiking trails like the Fonta Flora Loop in Lake James State Park or High Shoal Falls in South Mountains State Park before grabbing a refreshing craft beer at Fonta Flora’s open-air brewery at Whippoorwill Farm. Less than 25 minutes away, you’ll find the quaint small town of Marion where you can grab another cold one at Mica Town Brewing Company, fresh seafood and a cocktail at Crabby Abby’s Bar and Grille, or a handcrafted dish paired with the NC staple, Cheerwine, at McDowell Local. Before returning to your home away from home, shop around at the Lake James Antique Mall, or take a short 30-minute drive to the “Simply Charming” town of Morganton where you can find boutiques, novelty shops, regional museums, and art galleries to pick up a souvenir to remind you of your time in the mountains.Please note: This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee. This home is lakefront and offers its own private boat dock on Lake James to enjoy. For boat rentals, contact the Lake James Neighborhood Store (5 miles away) or Noah’s Landing (11 miles away).This home offers exclusive access to Camp Lake James community amenities, including a spacious pool & covered pavilion area with a cabana, but please note that the docks and fitness center are private and off-limits. Some blackout dates and holiday limitations apply. Please inquire for more information.

data.title: Stonewalls
data.description: Lovingly renovated and centrally located, Stonewalls is a beautiful Montreat Historic Home built in 1908. Like many of the homes in Montreat, this home has the feeling of seclusion while still being close to everything. Inside Stonewalls, historic charm meets modern sensibilities. Prepare your meals in a beautiful gourmet kitchen with a dual-fuel range, stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, and a custom live-edge dining table that seats eight. Gather in the dual living rooms to play board games or watch a movie. The light and airy living room off the primary bedroom has a queen size sleeper sofa. The primary bedroom itself is complete with a king bed and an ensuite bathroom with a walk-in shower. The upstairs bedrooms share a beautiful black and white tiled full hall bath with a walk-in shower and clawfoot tub. The common area at the top of the stairs has a twin bed, there's a bedroom with a queen and a twin with a window bench, and the pink and white bedroom has two full beds and a small desk. The cozy back porch with a swing and grill overlooks Robert Lake Park.Take a short walk down the stone path to access the small ballfield, tennis courts, and an award-winning creekside playground. Meander the easy walking trail, Elizabeth's Path as it runs along the beautiful and soothing Flat Creek. Peruse the ethically sourced handcrafted goods at Ten Thousand Village or the area-specific items at The Montreat Store. Grab a coffee or hand-scooped ice cream from The Huckleberry and take a walk around Lake Susan, or in the summer rent a paddle boat or go fishing. Montreat's trail system offers several hiking options from easy to strenuous and is within a few minute's drive of the home. Venture into Black Mountain, an eight-minute drive, to enjoy the small businesses and locally owned restaurants that line the downtown streets. From pub-style Appalachian to authentic Cuban, several local coffee roasters, and fantastic bakeries - Black Mountain has it all. If you've exhausted Black Mountain's offerings, travel another twenty minutes down the interstate to Asheville - where you can enjoy several James Beard-nominated restaurants and the booming beer scene. Take a walk down the newly completed greenway in the River Arts District and visit the galleries of local artisans. Spend a day at the Biltmore Estate - touring the historical Home, it's grounds and gardens, and the award-winning winery - before settling back in at the comforts of Stonewalls.The home has a minimum 3-night stay and a minimum 4 nights for holidays. Linens (sheets and towels) are available for an additional fee. House Layout: Main Floor- half bath near entry, kitchen and dining area, living room, second living room with sleeper sofa, master suite with full bath walk-in shower. Upper Level- a common area with twin bed, bedroom with two fulls, a bedroom with a queen and twin, full bath with walk-in shower and clawfoot tub.

data.title: Little Bow Cottage
data.description: Nestled between Montreat and Black Mountain, Little Bow Cottage is the modern mountain escape of your dreams! Tranquility and seclusion go hand in hand, yet you'll still enjoy easy access to all the shops, restaurants, breweries, and activities in town. Experience all four beautiful seasons and mountain views on the expansive porch (equipped with a fan to keep you cool on those hot summer days) while your pups play safely within the fenced yard. The chic Appalachian-inspired decor and contemporary touches will make you feel right at home!About the Home• Light and cozy living room with 60" Smart TV (streaming only), DVD player, and a wood-burning fireplace• Dining area with traditional and bench-style seating and open-concept kitchen with dishwasher and drip-style coffee maker• Loft with dedicated workspace and blackout curtains for privacy• Covered front porch with ceiling fan and comfortable seating• Lower level patio with ceiling fan, dart board, charcoal grill, and flexible seating • The bathrooms at Little Bow are configured to allow for flexibility while maintaining privacy. The main floor has an open sink and vanity area, a private shower room, and a private toilet room. The loft has an open sink and vanity area and a private toilet room. Where to Unwind• Main floor primary bedroom with a queen-size bed• Upper-level bedroom with 4 extra long twin-size beds and 30" TVWhere to Explore• The Laundry, Refillery + Essentials, Downtown Black Mountain | 7 minutes• Lake Susan, Montreat Conference Center | 9 minutes• Nearest Gas and Grocery, Ingles Market | 9 minutes• Beradu Specialty Market, Kitchen & Bar | 10 minutes• Lookout Mountain Trail Head | 12 minutes• The Blue Ridge Parkway | 19 minutes• Downtown Asheville + The Biltmore Estate | 25 minutesPlease Note: This home is located on a gravel road with a gravel driveway. AWD/4WD is recommended but not required. Accessing this treehouse-style cabin requires navigating one set of stone steps and one flight of wooden steps to reach the entrance, which may not be suitable for guests with limited mobility. There are 2 exterior cameras, one facing the driveway and one facing the brick patio.

data.title: Wendell's Ridge
data.description: Upon entering this polished retreat, you'll immediately be greeted by the bright and open layout. The interior color palette seamlessly ties earthy browns, fresh whites, and cozy greys together, along with pops of vibrant yellow, to create a bright and inviting atmosphere that will instantly put you at ease and in a vacation state of mind. Outside, you'll find a covered open-air deck that provides the perfect space to enjoy breakfast or dinner al fresco and take in mountain or woodland views depending on the season. In the morning, enjoy your coffee on the back deck while you feel the fresh breeze and listen to the sound of birds and wind rustling through the trees.After coffee, take the time to curl up on the couch with a good book, or take a late morning bath in the soaking tub while sipping a fresh mimosa. When you're ready, it is just a 20-minute stroll along the paved Flat Creek Greenway or a 3-minute drive into "The Little Town that Rocks," Black Mountain. Known as the "Front Porch of Western North Carolina," you'll spot the iconic red rocking chairs throughout this treasured small town that stand as your reminder to slow down, pull up a chair, and relax. Filled with novelty shops, art galleries, and boutiques, you can easily spend the entire day shopping for local goodies to help you remember your time in the mountains.As your morning coffee begins to wear off, stop into the Dripolator Coffeehouse for house-roasted coffee and locally-made pastries. Just next door you'll find the Swannanoa Valley Museum and the Black Mountain Center for the Arts. SVM explores the general history of the Swannanoa Valley, and BMCA offers public exhibits, concerts, theatre, and a myriad of classes for all ages. Their upper floor gallery offers vibrant and diverse exhibits from regional artists and those who have some connection to the area and are free to the public throughout the week. After exploring regional history and art, walk a few doors down to enjoy delicious pub fare at The Trailhead, or pop into any of the many locally-owned restaurants and shops along Cherry Street in downtown Black Mountain.For avid hikers, Montreat is a short 15-minute walk or a 2-minute drive away from Wendell's Ridge. Lookout Mountain is a great trail that's just under a mile long and offers stunning panoramic mountain views. As a reward for your hike, grab a cold one at Black Mountain Brewing or Lookout Brewing before heading over to Lake Tomahawk Park, where you can play a round of tennis, or take it easy on a bench to enjoy the view of the Seven Sisters Mountain range. In the evening, sit down to dinner at local favorite, Black Mountain Bistro, or head home to craft a delicious meal in the gourmet kitchen complete with stainless appliances and sparkling quartz countertops. After dinner, head downstairs to stream a movie or enjoy some friendly competition by playing board games together. Before turning in for the night, wander out onto the deck to stargaze, or gather around the newly added outdoor fire pit with a glass of wine to end the perfect day.Nestled amid the Blue Ridge Mountains, Wendell's Ridge is a tribute to both the renowned writer, environmental activist, and farmer, Wendell Berry, and the family dog who shares the same name. This certified silver "Green Built" home welcomes the entire family (including pets) to enjoy the majesty & calm of nature from a contemporary home base that offers unparalleled convenience!PLEASE NOTE: This home is pet-friendly with an additional $100 pet fee per pet. There are a total of 5 exterior cameras (1 at the driveway, 1 at the garage, 1 at the front door, 1 above the lower level egress door, and 1 on the south side), and the homeowner confirms the number of pets brought to the home via these exterior cameras. Please park in the gravel area ONLY (not in the mulch or dirt areas).

data.title: Hatton House
data.description: Welcome to Hatton House, a new Arts & Crafts townhome in the traditional neighborhood of Cheshire Village. Hatton House has all the comforts of home including a front porch made for socializing. The cozy living room invites all with its fireplace, gas logs, and stylishly comfortable Arts & Crafts decor. Relax with friends or family in the inviting outdoor courtyard with a gas grill and round wicker table to enjoy your meals together. The large TV with a DVD player, stereo iPod dock, and wireless internet allows you to remain connected.Discover the charm of Cheshire's tree-lined streets, gentle streams, and winding trails, with its convenient location just 20 minutes from Asheville. Hatton has 3 bedrooms, all located upstairs. The primary bedroom with a king bed has a full bath with shower only, another bedroom with Queen, and the third room has 2 twins and shares a full hall bath. Half bath downstairs. (If needed the sofa in the living room is a queen sleeper: SHEETS AND TOWELS NOT INCLUDED for this extra bedding.)Please Note: This house is pet friendly with an additional pet fee.

data.title: Gartrell Home
data.description: Located within a 2-minute drive and a 17-minute walk from Lake Susan, Robert Lake Playground, and the Conference Center, Gartrell Home is a spacious and historic Montreat home that's perfect for a mountain getaway with friends or family in the beautiful summer months. The main floor of the home offers a kitchen with eat-in dining, a formal living room, a den with a TV for streaming, a full bathroom, a laundry room (with a washer, dryer, and toilet), and a traditional "sleeping porch" with a queen size bed. The upper level has sleeping space for 9 with 4 bedrooms: one with a queen bed, one with a double bed, one with a king-size bed and two twin beds, and one with a twin bed. There is also a full bathroom with a clawfoot tub and shower. During your stay, explore Montreat's endless trail system that winds through lush rhododendron, alongside babbling creeks, and that scale cliff faces overlooking the valley and towns below. For avid hikers, Lookout Mountain is a great trail that rings in at just under a mile long and offers stunning panoramic mountain views, and there's also the epic 4.8-mile Graybeard trail with several spur trails, including one that leads to Walker Knob and another that leads to Graybeard Falls. Gartrell Home is also a 10-minute drive from Black Mountain. Known as the “Front Porch of Western North Carolina,” you’ll spot the iconic red rocking chairs throughout this treasured small town that stand as your reminder to slow down, pull up a chair, and relax. While in town, stop by Lookout Brewing and Black Mountain Brewing for a cold local beer, browse the novelty shops, and grab a bite at Pure & Proper, Taco Billy, or My Father's Pizza in the heart of downtown. If you're interested in experiencing a bit of city life during your trip, the home is just 25 minutes from the iconic Biltmore Estate and downtown Asheville where you can explore art galleries, dine at award-winning restaurants, and shop for some handcrafted souvenirs to remind you of your memorable time in the mountains.  Please note: This home is NOT pet friendly due to severe allergies. Linens are NOT provided but can be rented from Greybeard Rentals for an additional fee. This home rents from Saturday to Saturday from mid-May to mid-August and accepts youth groups. There is central air conditioning but the "sleeping porch" is not heated or cooled.

data.title: D-Natural
data.description: Your stay at D-Natural will have you feeling like you're in harmony with the world around you. Located in the quaint little mountain cove of Montreat, this log cabin feels as if it's tucked away in the woods, but is within a 15-minute walk to the center of Montreat and a short drive into downtown Black Mountain. Conference-goers, youth groups, friends, or families can enjoy a morning cup of coffee in the rocking chairs and porch swing, on the east-facing front porch as they watch the sun peak over the treetops. Recently renovated galley kitchen, with gas range, connects to the small dining room with seating for four (4). Take in nature from the comforts of the screened-in porch directly off the kitchen, with additional seating for six (6). The open-concept main floor has a lovely cathedral ceiling up to the loft, with two (2) sleeping spaces and a full hall-bath. The unfinished basement has an additional sleeping space with two (2) twin beds and a full bath.HOUSE LAYOUT: Main level: kitchen, screened-in porch, living room, bedroom with a queen bed, bedroom with two twins, full hall bath. Upstairs: loft with a double bed, bedroom with a double and two twins, full hall bath. Lower level: bedroom in the unfinished basement with two twins, full bath.D-Natural is only steps away from two trails in the Montreat system -the West Ridge trailhead and Lower Piney Trail, both moderate-rated connector trails. If you're looking for something less strenuous, take a walk down to Lake Susan and stroll down Elizabeth's Path alongside Flat Creek. Montreat has an excellent public park with tennis courts, a playground, and a small ballfield. Grab an ice cream or a coffee at the Huckleberry after browsing the wares at Ten Thousand Villages and the Montreat Store. After exhausting the wonders of the mountain cove, take a short drive into Black Mountain, America's Prettiest Small Town, and enjoy their blooming food and beer scene and focus on locally owned businesses.Please note: This house is pet friendly with an additional pet fee, and linens (sheets and towels) are available for an extra fee.

data.title: Best of Times
data.description: Located within the pristine & charming Village of Cheshire which boasts open greenspace, walking trails, a community garden, and shops & restaurants, this lovely townhome is situated on the corner, allowing more space and privacy. Best of Times is less than a mile from all of the activities, shops, restaurants, and breweries in downtown Black Mountain.About the Home• Best of Times offers high-speed WIFI with speeds of up to 400 Mbps that will allow you to seamlessly work remotely.• The open-concept main floor boasts a sleek living room with a gas log fireplace and SmartTV for streaming.• Galley-style kitchen with dishwasher and two types of coffee makers: Keurig and standard drip-style.• Formal dining area for 6 and covered, outdoor dining for 6.• A powder room is available on both the main floor and the upper level for additional convenience. • Impressive mountain views are on display from the upper-level bonus room with a reclining sofa, game table, various books, and access to a second covered deck with outdoor seating.Where to Unwind• The main floor primary bedroom offers a king-size and en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower and jetted, soaking tub.• The upper level offers two bedrooms, each with a queen-size bed. A full bathroom, with a bathtub and shower combination, can be accessed from the hallway.Where to Explore• Beradu Specialty Market, Kitchen & Bar | < 2 minute walk• Sake Sushi | < 2 minute walk• Nearest Gas, Ingles iMarket | 3 minutes• Nearest Grocery, Ingles Market | 3 minutes• Downtown Black Mountain | 4 minutes• Lookout Mountain Trail Head | 13 minutes• The Blue Ridge Parkway | 13 minutes• Downtown Asheville | 19 minutes• The Biltmore Estate | 25 minutesPlease note: This home is NOT pet-friendly. The garage is NOT accessible to guests. Due to the fire code, no street-side parking is permitted in front of this home. You can park there long enough to load/unload your car at the front door, but your vehicle should be parked in the commercial parking lot directly behind the townhouse at all other times.

data.title: Annie's Cabin
data.description: Annie's Cabin is brimming with personality, featuring vintage and antique items, many from Asheville area antique shops, and several special pieces from the owner's own collection. From the covered front deck, watch the trees and mountains change colors as the sun crosses the sky to the pink and blue hues of sunset.About the Home• Open-concept living, dining, and kitchen with dining for 4, charming den with cable TV, and mini bar area. The kitchen is equipped with a dishwasher and a standard, drip-style coffee maker.• Spacious, covered deck with outdoor dining for 4 and patio seating for 2.• Private hot tub and Breeo Smokeless fire pit with a cooking grate and cover.• This home is pet friendly with an additional pet fee.Where to Unwind• Primary bedroom with queen-size bed and en suite bathroom with bathtub and shower combination.• The second bedroom also offers a queen-size bed and full bathroom (bathtub and shower combination) with hallway access.Where to Explore• Nearest Gas, CITGO | 7 minutes• Nearest Grocery, Food Lion | 8 minutes• Whistle Hop Brewing Company | 8 minutes• Hickory Nut Gap Farm | 10 minutes• Strawberry Gap Trailhead | 15 minutes• Blue Ridge Parkway | 17 minutes• Biltmore Estate | 20 minutes• Lake Lure and Chimney Rock State Park | 30 minutesPlease Note: The driveway is steep, but paved & does require AWD/4WD from January through March. This home has 2 outdoor security cameras (one facing the driveway/front entrance and one facing the back porch door). There is currently a container in the driveway.

data.title: Viewmont
data.description: Spacious and immaculate Laurel Ridge home with mountain views and open living spaces, including two living areas, a gas fireplace, luxurious finishes, and a wonderful fire table to enjoy on the deck while soaking in the view. Gourmet kitchen on main level looking out into dining area and den make cooking fun! Laurel Ridge is a private, gated community 10 minutes from downtown Black Mountain's shopping and restaurants. You're also 20 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway and 25 minutes to downtown Asheville.House layout: The main level- enter the house into a spacious great room with vaulted ceilings and a large 48-inch Smart TV for streaming only (Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon via Roku), room with a table and 4 chairs that are perfect for playing cards or games; half bath; the primary bedroom has a king bed, an amazing view and a private full bath (which features a jetted tub with separate shower and double sinks); fully stocked gourmet kitchen and island that seats 3; dining area and table that seats 8 (additional chairs available in next room); second living room/den that is featured off the kitchen with gas logs. Upstairs- A bedroom with a queen bed and full bath (shower only). Another bedroom with a queen bed. There is a full bath (Jack-n-Jill style) that you can access from the hallway or this bedroom with the queen bed. There is a room with 2 twin beds and another room with a double bed and coffee bar with sink. Outdoors- large deck with incredible views of the mountain and reservoir; fire table and gas grill; easily accessible parking for 4 cars and access to the garage if needed.Please note there is a "whole house" generator so if there is a power outage, you won't even know. Greybeard homes are located in close proximity to Pisgah National Forest. Ladybugs and Kudzu Beetles may be seen in our area in the fall and winter months, and it is not uncommon for them to find their way into homes to escape the cooler weather from time to time. They are not poisonous and cannot be exterminated.

data.title: Carriage House
data.description: Carriage House is a charming and cozy cottage nestled in the mountains of Montreat. The home has two levels, each with its own living room, kitchen, bedroom, bath, and washer/dryer. With comfort in mind, the owners have furnished the home with beautiful pieces, and the home includes air conditioning, wireless internet, Youtube TV (streaming service), and other modern amenities.The top and bottom levels are connected by an outdoor stairwell. A deck is located on the lower level and a screened-in porch is on the upper level. Easy entry to the upper level with parking for 2 cars. Located in Montreat a short drive down to the conference center and Lake Susan, you are also less than a 10-minute drive to downtown Black Mountain where you can pick up groceries or dinner. Asheville is less than a half-hour drive to see the Biltmore Estate.HOUSE LAYOUT: Upstairs: Kitchen, living room with queen sleeper sofa, BR with queen and full bath with walk-in shower and grab bar for easy accessibility. Downstairs: Kitchenette, sitting area with twin sleeper, BR with two twins, full bath.Please Note: Carriage House does not provide linens, but they are available to rent through Greybeard. One dog of any size is welcome at Carriage House during your stay for an additional fee. Due to the owner's allergies, regretfully no cats are permitted. To enhance your comfort, all of the mattresses were replaced in August of 2022!

data.title: Lake Lured Away
data.description: While Lake Lure remains closed to swimming, boating, and fishing in 2025, there is still plenty to enjoy in the Town of Lake Lure! Chimney Rock State Park is closed until further notice but plans to reopen as soon as possible. Most restaurants in town are open for business along with beautiful trails and greenspaces (including Dittmer-Watts Nature Trails, Lake Lure Green Space, Pool Creek Picnic Park, Youngs Mountain, and Rumbling Bald Golf Courses). Find additional updates and information here. ***THE PRIVATE DOCK IS TEMPORARILY UNAVAILABLE AND PENDING CONSTRUCTION. COMPLETION DATE TBD.***Get lured away at this relaxing lakeside cottage in beautiful Lake Lure. Lake Lured Away will be your summer haven where you can enjoy swimming, canoeing, nearby hiking, and more. Tucked away at the end of a quiet cove and across the street from the lake and private dock, the home will offer guests tranquil mornings out on the balcony and peaceful evenings eating alfresco out on the patio. While the home has everything you'll need for your stay, including a full kitchen, game room with a ping pong table and card table, Wi-Fi, and outdoor grill, you'll spend all your time outside on the spacious, upper-level deck with picturesque views of the lake and mountain peaks. There's a swimming ladder for easy access into the water, along with a canoe that is permitted by the Town of Lake Lure. Also, your furry 4-legged friends will love the fenced backyard.Conveniently located on the northern side of Lake Lure, you're less than 10 minutes to Chimney Rock Village and the Lake Lure Community Beach & Water Park. Grab a decadent breakfast from Medina's Bistro before heading across the street to Chimney Rock State Park. When you're done taking in the views, head back into the Village to shop local boutiques and gift shops and unwind with a glass of wine at Burntshirt Vineyards and Bistro. Asheville is a 45-minute drive from Lake Lured Away and is perfect for a day trip to explore this culturally diverse and unique city. While in town, schedule a tour of the Biltmore Estate and explore the exquisite grounds and special exhibits.PLEASE NOTE: Lake Lured Away has a staircase that leads to its private dock on the lake, but the home itself is located across the street from the lake. This home is pet-friendly with an additional pet fee. Wireless Internet is extremely limited due to the connectivity of the provider, and cell phone service is not guaranteed. This home has central AC on the main level and localized mini splits in the upper-level bedrooms. This home has a 7-day minimum stay requirement (Saturday-Saturday) during the summer months. Lake Lured Away is subject to specific regulations and guidelines enforced by Lake Lure. Certain types of watercraft are prohibited, and ALL watercraft (motorized and non-motorized) must obtain and display a permit issued by the town to be on the lake. Renters do not have access to the boat storage beneath the deck. Also, from November to March, Lake Lure lowers water levels to about 12 ft. below normal levels.

data.title: Fireside Retreat
data.description: Enter on the main level to be welcomed by a spacious floor plan and soaring ceilings. A formal living room opens to the dining room, kitchen, open-air deck, and screened-in porch with lounge chairs. Continue from the kitchen into the garage for foosball and ping pong or to the wood-burning solo stove overlooking the private backyard. The main level of the home also offers a laundry room with a washer & dryer and a primary bedroom with a king-size bed and an en suite bathroom with an oversized soaking tub, walk-in shower, and double vanity. Interested in star gazing? Explore the upper-level loft with a reading chair, telescope, and dedicated workspace. For additional entertaining space, the lower level of the home boasts a second living room with a sleeper sofa, television for streaming, gas logs fireplace, and access to the covered deck with a gas grill and an 8-person hot tub. Also on the lower level are two bedrooms, each with a queen-sized bed and en suite bathroom.Fireside Retreat is located within the beautiful gated community of Catawba Falls Preserve where wildlife is abundant and sightings can be frequent and very exciting. There are multiple hiking trails in this exquisite community, and the roads are paved and easily navigated. A favorite hike in the community is Catawba Falls (two trail options to Upper or Lower Falls). Perfect for the whole family, the Lower Catawba Falls is a 2.5-mile round-trip trek that takes you to a 100' cascading waterfall with multiple tiers of water rushing over vibrant green moss. The steep trail that continues up the right side of the waterfall eventually levels out and is less than 1/4 mile to Upper Catawba Falls. Whether you stay at the lower falls or brave the upper falls, both are breathtaking sights that are a must for waterfall enthusiasts! Take a quick 20-minute drive to reach downtown Black Mountain. Known as the “Front Porch of Western North Carolina,” the town boasts 3 local breweries (Lookout Brewing, Pisgah Brewing, and Black Mountain Brewing) along with novelty shops, art galleries, parks, and incredible restaurants like Trailhead Restaurant & Bar, Louise's Kitchen, and Black Mountain Bistro. After experiencing all that Black Mountain has to offer, take time to explore the “Land of Sky,” Asheville just 35 minutes away. While there, check out the hip and artsy West Asheville district, North Carolina Arboretum, and iconic Biltmore Estate, and sample the award-winning restaurants and breweries between all your activities. Take a 35-minute drive south to reach Lake Lure and the Village of Chimney Rock and its corresponding Chimney Rock State Park. Spend your days hiking on the various trails within the state park, browsing the adorable shops, strolling atop the quirky and colorful Lake Lure Flowering Bridge, or soaking up the sun, swimming, and canoeing on Lake Lure’s Mountain Beach & Waterpark. Grab lunch at Lake House Restaurant Bar & Grill, La Strada, or Point of View before having a cold beer at Hickory Nut Gorge Brewery or a glass of locally-curated wine at Burntshirt Vineyards. Please note: This home is pet-friendly with an additional fee. No parking is allowed on roadways, at gate entrances, or in non-paved areas in the Catawba Falls Community. Please keep your vehicle(s) on the driveway only.

data.title: High Haven
data.description: Truly get away from it all at stunning High Haven! This home is perched at the base of the Craggy Mountains and overlooks the sweeping Swannanoa Valley. Watch the sunrise over the Blue Ridge Mountains at 4,000 feet from the cozy living area or back deck, and at night, enjoy the dazzling city lights of Black Mountain and Swannanoa in the distance. A quick 15-minute drive from the shops, restaurants, breweries, and activities in the charming small town of Black Mountain, High Haven promises convenience along with tranquility!The primary bedroom is surrounded by a large bank of oversized windows, and the bath has a platformed Jacuzzi tub. The professional quality kitchen with granite countertops has a Standard Drip and Keurig coffeemaker available. A new widescreen 47-inch HDTV has been added to the living area, and a 37-inch HDTV has been added to the primary bedroom. This home also offers high-speed internet for your convenience. HOUSE LAYOUT:Main Level: Kitchen; Living room; Dining area; Half bath.Upper Level: Primary bedroom with queen bed and garden tub; Bedroom with queen bed; Full hall bath; Open sleeping loft with two twin beds.Please Note: Linens are provided for your convenience. NO PETS AND NO SMOKING. There is an exterior camera that faces the driveway.

data.title: The Chapman House
data.description: The Chapman House was built in 1900 and is one of 14 historic cottages constructed for the Biltmore Estate workers employed by Vanderbilt in the early 20th century. Designed by Robert Sharp Smith, his notable "Biltmore-style" buildings are a blend of English Arts and Craft and Elizabethan Tudor, giving it the look of a charming countryside cottage in an English village. This unique vacation rental is in the heart of Biltmore Village within walking distance of its shops and restaurants. Take a 1-minute walk to Corner Kitchen or Well-Bred Bakery & Cafe across the street, a 2-minute walk to Fig, or a 3-minute walk to The Cantina. The Biltmore House & Gardens, a National Historic Landmark, is a 2-minute drive away, making The Chapman House the perfect getaway spot for a couple or solo traveler planning to explore the "Gilded Age" gem and everything else the city of Asheville has to offer!Please Note: This rental is pet-friendly with an additional fee, but only dogs under 50 lbs are permitted. This apartment-style unit is on the upper level of a historic home. The lower level is home to a business, All Souls Grotto, which is a craft cannabis and bottle shop. Keep in mind that cannabis products produce a unique smell that can sometimes drift upstairs. While we do have an air purifier set up in the home, travelers with smell sensitivity and asthma might not be the best fit for this one-of-a-kind vacation rental.
